name: Lost for Words! 12 Quiz | Lyrics Mixture | 10 Questions

questions.text:
"Another ______ night and I ain't got nobody, 
I got some money 'cause I just got paid" 

Which night of the week is Sam Cooke singing about?
questions.explanation:
Saturday.

	"Another Saturday Night" was a hit for Sam Cooke in 1963. A singer/songwriter Sam was born in Mississippi in 1931, he died in 1964.

questions.text:
"Tie a yellow ribbon 'round the ole ______ tree
It's been three long years
Do ya still want me?"

So what type of tree was the yellow ribbon tied around?
questions.explanation:
oak.

	Dawn featuring Tony Orlando had a hit with "Tie A Yellow Ribbon Round The Ole Oak Tree" in 1973. This song, which topped the charts on both sides of the Atlantic, was written by Irwin Levine and L. Russell Brown.

questions.text:
"But she's gettin' by, doin' what she can 
She is free to be, what she wants to be 
'N all she wants to be, is a _______ girl"

What type of girl does the singer want to be?
questions.explanation:
modern.

	These lyrics come from "Modern Girl", a 1980 hit for Sheena Easton.Sheena, winner of the 1981 "Grammy Best New Artist" award, was born in Scotland  1959.

questions.text:
Which word is missing from this lyric?

"We don't need no ______ 
We dont need no thought control 
No dark sarcasm in the classroom 
Teachers leave them kids alone 
Hey teachers! Leave them kids alone 
All in all it's just another brick in the wall."
questions.explanation:
education.

	"Another Brick In The Wall" was a 1979 chart topper for Pink Floyd in both the US and UK. This track features on the group's "P.U.L.S.E" and "The Wall" albums.

questions.text:
"Sittin' in the mornin' sun 
I'll be sittin' when the evenin' come 
Watching the ______ roll in 
And then I watch 'em roll away again, yeah" 

So what was Otis Redding watching roll in and out on the dock of the bay?
questions.explanation:
ships.

	Otis Redding recorded "(Sittin' on) The Dock of the Bay" just a few days before he died in a plane crash in 1967.  Otis co-wrote this track with Steve Cropper. "(Sittin' on) The Dock of the Bay" was a US and UK chart topper in 1968.

questions.text:
"So we sailed up to the sun 
Till we found a sea of green 
And we lived beneath the waves 
in our ______ submarine"

What colour is the submarine?
questions.explanation:
yellow.

	The Beatles "Yellow Submarine", written by John Lennon and Paul McCartney, was released in 1966. It is estimated that the Beatles have worldwide sales of more than a billion records.

questions.text:
"Well, shake it up baby now
______ and shout
Come on, come on, come, come on baby now
Come on and work it on out"

Which word is missing from this lyric?
questions.explanation:
Twist.

	Motown outfit The Isley Brothers hit with "Twist And Shout" in 1963. As of 2004 five versions of this song, written by Medley and Russell, have featured in the UK charts.

questions.text:
"Get out in that ______
And rattle those pots and pans"

Lyrics from a classic Bill Haley rock song, but which room were we being told to get out to?
questions.explanation:
kitchen.

	These lyrics come from "Shake Rattle And Roll" by Bill Haley And His Comets. One of the earliest rock 'n' roll hits "Shake Rattle And Roll" was released in 1954. With his trademark kiss-curl hairstyle rock 'n' roll pioneer Bill Haley, who died in 1981, had a string of hits in the 1950s.

questions.text:
"Such a feeling's comin' over me 
There is ______ in 'most every thing I see"

What word completes this Carpenters song Lyric?
questions.explanation:
wonder.

	Richard and Karen Carpenter released "Top Of The World" in 1973. This track was a US chart topper peaking at #5 in the UK. Karen died in 1983.

questions.text:
Which woman's name is missing from this lyric?

"Mustang ______, think you better slow your mustang down
Mustang ______, think you better slow your mustang down"
questions.explanation:
Sally.

	"Mustang Sally" was a 1966 hit for Wilson Pickett. Pickett hit with a string of 1960s dance floor fillers including  "In the Midnight Hour" and "Land of 1000 Dances".
